str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Immortality, imperishability, freedom from death. From a compound of a and thanatos; deathlessness.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To inhabit, dwell, indwell. From oikos; to occupy a house, i.e. Reside; by implication, to cohabit.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

str2: A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
Dominion, strength, power; a mighty deed. Perhaps a primary word; vigor.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
